title: Route 181 - Fragments of a Journey in Palestine-Israel (2002)
description:
In this three part documentary two filmmakers, Michel Khleifi 
and Eyal Sivan, both from Palestine-Israel, follow the partition 
lines passed in Resolution 181 in 1947 by the United Nations 
dividing the British Mandate of Palestine into two countries - 
Israel and Palestine. 

When the British left and partition was to take place in 1948 
war erupted with Jordan and Israel grabbing most of the territory 
awarded to the Palestinians (West Bank and adjacent areas, 
Northern Palestine, areas surroundig Gaza), while Egypt took the 
Gaza Strip. 

The two filmmakers Michel Khleifi and Eyal Sivan travel 
along the border that only ever existed on maps and listen 
to the stories and views of different people on their way. 

Languages: Arabic/Hebrew, soft ENGLISH subtitles (SRT)

Xvid (576x352, 25fps), MP3 (48KHz, 118 Kbps)
